reg:regulation.reg:title: Licence to Cut Regulation
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 157/2012, June 25, 2012]

bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 47.6 (2) (d) of the Forest Act, harvesting Crown timber to protect a community from wildfire is prescribed.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 47.6 (2) (d) of the Forest Act, the minister may enter into a forestry licence to cut under which harvesting is restricted to Crown timber that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the opinion of the minister, is in danger, as a result of an insect infestation, fire, disease or windthrow, of being significantly reduced in value, lost or destroyed, or
must be harvested for insect management purposes.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a forestry licence to cut is entered into under subsection (1), it may, in the discretion of the minister, include Crown timber that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is interspersed with timber described in that subsection, or
must be harvested to provide access to timber described in that subsection.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (4), the total volume of Crown timber that may be specified in a forestry licence to cut entered into under this section must not exceed 2 000 m3.

The minister may enter into a forestry licence to cut for a volume exceeding 2 000 m3, but not exceeding 5 000 m3, if the forestry licence to cut is entered into as the result of a competitive process.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Harvesting Crown timber within a controlled recreation area established under the Resort Timber Administration Act is prescribed for the purposes of section 47.6 (2) (d) of the Forest Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Harvesting in conjunction with a government funded contract
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 47.6 (2) (d) of the Forest Act, the minister may enter into a forestry licence to cut with a person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if harvesting is restricted to Crown timber located on an area which is subject to a contract

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: that was entered into with the person as the result of a competitive process,
that provides for the preparation of the area for reforestation or for the restoration of grassland or open forest, and
in respect of which the matters referred to subparagraph (ii) are funded by government,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in order to carry out the contract referred to in paragraph (a).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Applications for fibre supply licences to cut
bcl:section.bcl:text: The following requirements are prescribed for the purposes of section 47.71 (2) (b) of the Forest Act:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the application must be in the form specified by the minister;

if required by the advertisement inviting applications, the application must contain or be accompanied by a sealed bonus bid payable to the government in addition to other amounts payable under the Forest Act in respect of the licence;
the application must contain or be accompanied by the information specified by the minister for the purpose of evaluating the application under section 6 of this regulation.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Criteria for evaluating applications for
fibre supply licences to cut
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 47.71 (3) of the Forest Act, the minister must evaluate applications for a fibre supply licence to cut on the basis of any of the following factors, and to the extent, that the minister considers applicable in respect of the licence and sets out in the advertisement inviting applications for that licence:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the amount and sufficiency of the revenue the licence is anticipated to generate for the government;
the best use of the Crown timber;
the economic value to British Columbia of existing facilities proposed to receive and use the timber removed under the licence;
the economic value to British Columbia of facilities proposed to be modified or constructed to receive and use the timber removed under the licence.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Purpose for master licence to cut
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 47.4 (2) (b) (ii) of the Act, constructing or operating a pipeline is a prescribed purpose.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Forest Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 157, section 47.6]
